alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 9:25PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 922 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - A period of heavy rain will produce rainfall amounts of half an inch to an inch. Tide levels are rising as we head into high tide which will occur around 11 pm. The combination of heavy rainfall and elevated tide levels will produce minor flooding in and around Downtown Charleston through the late evening hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Fort Sumter, Downtown Charleston, James Island, Daniel Island, West Ashley, Johns Island, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Sullivan`s Island, Fort Johnson, Sullivans Island, Charleston Naval Complex, Mount Pleasant Towne Centre, James Island County Park, Charles Towne Landing, Maybank Bridge and Boone Hall Plantation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
